Class HangmanTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • HangmanTest

  • public class HangmanTest
extends Object
    Suite of tests for the Hangman class. Uses JUnit 4.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Brian von Behren

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      org.junit.rules.ExpectedException exception
      Rule for testing that specified exceptions are thrown.
      private static String FULL_DICTIONARY
      Path to a large text file containing a list of legal Scrabble words.
      private static int GOAL_LENGTH
      Default goal length.
      private int GUESS_LIMIT
      Default number of allowed guesses.
      private String SHORT_DICTIONARY
      Path to a text file containing a short list of 5-letter words.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HangmanTest() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void guessingALetterWhenNoGoalWordThrowsError()
      Tests that an IllegalStateException is thrown if a guess is made when no the list of goal words is empty.
      void guessingALetterWhenNoGuessesRemainThrowsError()
      Tests that an IllegalStateException is thrown if an attempt is made to guess a letter when remaining guesses is zero.
      void guessingTheSameLetterTwiceThrowsError()
      Tests that an IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the same letter is guessed more than once.
      void hangmanConstructorThrowsErrorWhenAnArgumentIsOutOfRange()
      Tests that the Hangman constructor throws an IllegalArgumentException when any of the following are true: The dictionary is empty The length of the goal word is zero The number of allowed guesses is zero
      void helloReturnsCorrectPatternAfterSuccessiveCorrectGuesses()
      When the goal word is "hello", tests that the pattern and state is correct after each guess of the letters 'h', 'e', 'l', and 'o'.
      void helloReturnsCorrectPatternsAndStateAfterMixOfCorrectAndIncorrectGuesses()
      When the goal word is "hello", tests that the pattern and state is correct after each guess of the letters 'r', 's', 't', 'l', 'n', and 'e' Note: Mix of correct and incorrect guesses Please see testWordPatternsAndGuessesCount(String, List, List, List).
      private HangmanManager setupBasicManager(String filename, int validLength, int guessLimit)
      Sets-up a Hangman manger by creating a dictionary of strings from a text file.
      private HangmanManager setupSingleWordManager(String word, int guessLimit)
      Sets-up a Hangman manager that has a single word in its dictionary.
      void singleWordDictionaryReturnsCorrectGoalWord()
      Tests that the set of goalWords contains the correct word when the dictionary contains only a single word.
      private void testWordPatternsAndGuessesCount(String goalWord, List<Character> guesses, List<String> expectedPatterns, List<Integer> expectedCounts)
      Multi-faceted test for checking the state of the Hangman class.
      void whenNoLettersHaveBeenGuessedReturnPatternIsStringOfDashes()
      Tests that the patterns returned for a five- and three- letter goal word is "- - - - -" and "- - -" when no letters have been guessed.
      void wordListContainsWordsOfCorrectSize()
      Tests that all candidate goal words are of the correct size.
      void wordListReturnsSizeOfZeroWhenNoWordsMatchGivenLength()
      Tests that list returned by words() is of size zero if no words in the dictionary match the goalWord length.

        public HangmanTest()

    • Method Detail

      • setupBasicManager

        private HangmanManager setupBasicManager(String filename,
                                         int validLength,
                                         int guessLimit)
        Sets-up a Hangman manger by creating a dictionary of strings from a text file.
        Parameters:
        filename - path of the dictionary file. Words must be separated by lines
        validLength - the length of the goal word
        guessLimit - the number of allowed guesses
        Returns:
        a HangmanManager instance

      • setupSingleWordManager

        private HangmanManager setupSingleWordManager(String word,
                                              int guessLimit)
        Sets-up a Hangman manager that has a single word in its dictionary.
        Parameters:
        word - the goal word
        guessLimit - the number of wrong guesses allowed
        Returns:
        a HangmanManager instance

      • testWordPatternsAndGuessesCount

        private void testWordPatternsAndGuessesCount(String goalWord,
                                             List<Character> guesses,
                                             List<String> expectedPatterns,
                                             List<Integer> expectedCounts)
        Multi-faceted test for checking the state of the Hangman class. Given a goalWord and letters to guess, tests that the patterns return match what is expected; also tests that the number of remaining guesses corresponds to the number of incorrect guesses
        Parameters:
        goalWord - a single goal word to test against
        guesses - a list of characters to guess
        expectedPatterns - a list of strings corresponding to the expected pattern after each guess
        expectedCounts - a list of the expected number of letters revealed by each guess

      • hangmanConstructorThrowsErrorWhenAnArgumentIsOutOfRange

        public void hangmanConstructorThrowsErrorWhenAnArgumentIsOutOfRange()
        Tests that the Hangman constructor throws an IllegalArgumentException when any of the following are true:
        • The dictionary is empty
        • The length of the goal word is zero
        • The number of allowed guesses is zero

      • wordListContainsWordsOfCorrectSize

        public void wordListContainsWordsOfCorrectSize()
        Tests that all candidate goal words are of the correct size.

      • wordListReturnsSizeOfZeroWhenNoWordsMatchGivenLength

        public void wordListReturnsSizeOfZeroWhenNoWordsMatchGivenLength()
        Tests that list returned by words() is of size zero if no words in the dictionary match the goalWord length. Currently ignored because this state causes an exception to be thrown during construction of the Hangman class.

      • whenNoLettersHaveBeenGuessedReturnPatternIsStringOfDashes

        public void whenNoLettersHaveBeenGuessedReturnPatternIsStringOfDashes()
        Tests that the patterns returned for a five- and three- letter goal word is "- - - - -" and "- - -" when no letters have been guessed.

      • singleWordDictionaryReturnsCorrectGoalWord

        public void singleWordDictionaryReturnsCorrectGoalWord()
        Tests that the set of goalWords contains the correct word when the dictionary contains only a single word.

      • helloReturnsCorrectPatternAfterSuccessiveCorrectGuesses

        public void helloReturnsCorrectPatternAfterSuccessiveCorrectGuesses()
        When the goal word is "hello", tests that the pattern and state is correct after each guess of the letters 'h', 'e', 'l', and 'o'. Note: All guesses reveal letters. Please see testWordPatternsAndGuessesCount(String, List, List, List)

      • helloReturnsCorrectPatternsAndStateAfterMixOfCorrectAndIncorrectGuesses

        public void helloReturnsCorrectPatternsAndStateAfterMixOfCorrectAndIncorrectGuesses()
        When the goal word is "hello", tests that the pattern and state is correct after each guess of the letters 'r', 's', 't', 'l', 'n', and 'e' Note: Mix of correct and incorrect guesses Please see testWordPatternsAndGuessesCount(String, List, List, List).

      • guessingALetterWhenNoGuessesRemainThrowsError

        public void guessingALetterWhenNoGuessesRemainThrowsError()
        Tests that an IllegalStateException is thrown if an attempt is made to guess a letter when remaining guesses is zero.

      • guessingALetterWhenNoGoalWordThrowsError

        public void guessingALetterWhenNoGoalWordThrowsError()
        Tests that an IllegalStateException is thrown if a guess is made when no the list of goal words is empty. This exception is required by the HangmanManager interface, but under the current Hangman implementation it is not possible to reach this state since a similar exception is thrown in the constructor.
        See Also:
        Hangman

      • guessingTheSameLetterTwiceThrowsError

        public void guessingTheSameLetterTwiceThrowsError()
        Tests that an IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the same letter is guessed more than once.
